resources.string: "Unable to generate keys for wireless debugging. The KeyStore mechanism on this device may be broken."
View and enter the pairing code to finish mapping activation.
Enter the pairing code to activate:
MIUI users may need to go to Settings > Notifications & Control center > Notification shade, then switch to Android notification style.
Otherwise, you may not be able to enter the pairing code in the notification bar.

Go to your phone’s Settings > About phone, then continuously tap [Bulid number] for 6 times until it’s shown “Developer mode has been turned on” on your screen. Then go to Developer options and enable USB debugging.
Enable Show notifications of GameSir App
Please allow GameSir App to send you notifications when pairing.
"Samsung users may not be able to find it, please tap the left of Wireless debugging option to enter Wireless debugging page. "
Enter the Wireless debugging interface, tap Pair device with pairing code and you will see a 6-digit pairing code.
Remember the pairing code. Please just keep the pairing code interface in the foreground and do not perform any return or App switch operations.
Pull down the notification bar of your phone, enter the 6-digit pairing code and tap the right button. After a while, GameSir App will start activation automatically.
Go to your phone’s Settings > Other settings > Developer options > Wireless debugging.
Settings will be applied in secondary menus or above such as backpack, pick list, maps

%1$sPress this button to simulate a human hand touching the screen, and it will be lifted immediately.

%1$sThe button will become 2.Press this button to simulate a Semi-auto action, and after releasing the button, it will perform a Semi-auto action again. These two times correspond to the up and down buttons of the keys respectively.

Long press the View + Menu + Home button for 5 seconds, and the Home light and Mode light flash, successfully entering the calibration Mode.
Long press the View + Menu + Home button for 5 seconds, and the Home light and Mode light flash, Press A to entering the calibration Mode.
*After the rocker is rotated 3 times at the maximum angle, it will naturally return to its initial position.
*Press the trigger button to the bottom and release it, repeat after 3 times, it will naturally return to its initial position.
Press A to finish and exit calibration mode.
*During calibration, Please maintain a constant speed and tap operations carefully to avoid errors.
*If the controller can be used normally, please dont calibrate them.

*Effective only for this session, press the HOME key to invoke

"1.Place the button at the starting position for the slide, then press the button to simulate a swipe in the predetermined direction on the screen. This simulation occurs once per press. 2.The higher the sliding sensitivity, the faster the sliding speed. To enable continuous sliding, press and hold the button; release to stop."
Only for certain MOBA games that has the drag-to-cancel-cast function. Drag this button to the cancel casr area, and you may press this button to cancel a cast anytime during the gamplay.
When you are pressing the skill button in Skill Wheel Mode, press this button to cancel the cast, then you are good to release both buttons.
Press down the left joystick to trigger L3.
Press down the right joystick to trigger R3.
%1$sPress this button to simulate a human hand touching the screen, and it will be lifted immediately.

%1$sThe button will become 2.Press this button to simulate a Semi-auto action, and after releasing the button, it will perform a Semi-auto action again. These two times correspond to the up and down buttons of the keys respectively.

"Usually used for spellcasting in MOBA games. Select an associated joystick and adjust its skill wheel range. Then, you may press down the button and push the associated joystick to any direction to cast a spell. If you selected both left and right, you may press down the button and use either left joystick and right joystick to control."
Due to issues with some mobile phone systems, the controller operation feedback may not match the mapping configuration. You can attempt to correct this issue using this feature setting.
This setting needs to be reconfigured after switching to a different controller model. It defaults to following the system.
Click the key to simultaneously trigger click in a certain area. Key size adjustable.
This feature records and replays your gesture with precise timing and positioning. Note that button placement does not affect gesture playback.
Simulates consecutive tapping on the screen.

It simulates controlling the virtual joystick on the screen. When you selected this mode, you may drag the button over the joystick, adjust the size and control the on-screen joystick. Some games would recommend to set the delay, for example, 11ms for FPSs and 4ms for MOBAs.
Long press to delete the button and following buttons
This mode splits the button into two, triggering both simultaneously upon press or release. Please adjust the button positions after selecting this mode.
You can enter menu settings - Help - Switch HID mode to view
Press any button and start to record
Please set the button position first.

To set an One Button Marco, tap the grey buttons to make it green and activated. Tap again to remove the button. You may adjust the delay time between buttons. If the delay of two buttons is zero, it means they will be triggered at the same time.
It simulates the finger sliding on the screen. Usually used for camera control. You may adjust the sensitivity.
Delete the button and following buttons?
By holding: press the key to activate, release to stop.
By pressing: press the key to activate.
By releasing: release the key to activate.
The sensitivity value must be less than the length value.
Drag the button to the virtual button position that controls the movement of the character, and press W / A / S / d to control the character moving part of the game may need to increase the delay.
Switch to clock mode for the time input.
Switch to text input mode for the time input.

You may adjust the setting after selecting this plan
tap the icon to change the button

"1. Delay time: How long does it take to start the setting after the shooting (set to 0 to execute immediately after shooting)
2. Interval time: How much time is spent shooting a bullet (the smaller the value, the faster the pressure is pressed down, generally 0.01s)
3. Distance: The distance that the muzzle moves down after shooting a bullet (the larger the value, the greater the distance each time it is pressed down)"
Switching the set plan: During gameplay, press the hotkey to switch the set plans. Or you can press plan switcher hotkey.
E.g Assumes that you have 3 set plans and make them hotkey 1/2/3, you can press 1/2/3 to switch to the exact set plan you want, or you can make a plan switcher hotkey to change the set plan in order.
Switching the set plan: when you press associated fire hotkey, it turn on the auto spray function with the set plan (make sure associate fire hotkey is same to fire button)
E.g if you associate the click button with auto-spray function, you will have auto-spray ability when firing.

This can make mouse acceleration behave more naturally for remote desktop usage, but it is incompatible with many games.
Disable on-screen connection warning messages while streaming
Allows audio effects to function while streaming, but may increase audio latency
Allows the stream to be viewed (but not controlled) while multitasking
Allow GFE to modify game settings for optimal streaming
Switches the face buttons A/B and X/Y for gamepads and the on-screen controls

"Uses your device's built-in motion sensors if gamepad sensors are not supported by your connected gamepad or your Android version. Note: Enabling this option may cause your gamepad to appear as a PlayStation controller on the host."
Enables supported hosts to request motion sensor data when emulating a gamepad with motion sensors. Disabling may slightly reduce power and network usage if motion sensors are not being used in game.
Forces gamepad touchpad input to control the host mouse, even when emulating a gamepad with a touchpad.
Play audio from the computer and this device
Long pressing the Start button will switch the gamepad into mouse mode
Enabling this option may break right clicking on some buggy devices
Unchecking this option forces a gamepad to always be present
Lower display refresh rates can save power at the expense of some additional video latency
Show virtual controller overlay on touchscreen
Smaller box art in the app grid allows more apps to be visible on screen
If enabled, the touchscreen acts like a trackpad. If disabled, the touchscreen directly controls the mouse cursor.
"Use GameHub's USB driver for all supported gamepads, even if native Xbox controller support is present"
Vibrates your device to emulate rumble if your gamepad does not support it
Vibrates your device to emulate rumble for the on-screen controls
Enables a built-in USB driver for devices without native Xbox controller support
May reduce micro-stuttering on some devices, but can increase latency
Stream HDR when the game and PC GPU support it. HDR requires a GPU with HEVC Main 10 encoding support.
Display real-time stream performance information while streaming
Display a latency information message after the stream ends
Increase for a smoother video stream. Decrease for better performance on lower end devices.
Specify how to balance video latency and smoothness
"This will cause loss of detail in light and dark areas if your device doesn't properly display full range video content."
Hide all virtual buttons except L3 and R3
Make the on-screen controls more/less transparent
Resets all on-screen controls to their default size and position
Increase to improve image clarity. Decrease for better performance on lower end devices and slower networks.
Increase for better image quality. Decrease to improve performance on slower connections.
Note: Some games can enforce a larger deadzone than what GameHub is configured to use.
Amplify or reduce the vibration intensity on your device
View instructions on how to set up your gaming PC for streaming
Show the guide button on screen
View tips for diagnosing and fixing common streaming issues
"Streaming at 90 or 120 FPS may reduce latency on high-end devices but can cause lag or instability on devices that can't support it"
Newer codecs can lower video bandwidth requirements if your device supports them. Codec selections may be ignored if not supported by the host software or GPU.
Synchronize left and right light ring colors
Sorry, property setting is not available for D-pad button.

"Native resolution and/or FPS may not be supported by the streaming server. You will probably need to configure a matching custom display mode for the host PC manually.
If you choose to create a custom resolution in NVIDIA Control Panel to match your screen settings, please ensure you have read and understood NVIDIA's warning regarding possible monitor damage, PC instability, and other potential problems.
We are not responsible for any problems resulting from creating a custom resolution on your PC.
It may be that your monitor does not support a necessary display configuration. If so, you may try to set up a virtual monitor. Finally, if your device or host PC does not support streaming at a specific resolution or refresh rate, you're out of luck unfortunately."

Usually used for MOBA games. By selecting this mode, you can drag and place the icon to the on-screen joystick, then adjust the size to cover the joystick range. In games, right click the mouse on anywhere of the screen to control the joystick.

"Press mouse wheel button to turn on/off the cursor mode. When cursor mode is on, you may not move the in-game camera. It simulate sliding the screen to control the in-game camera. You must use this button to control the camera or turn on the cursor mode. Camera Movement Sensitivity: the speed of camera movement. Default number is 100. Using high DPI mouse may require lower sensitivity. X & Y axis sensitivity can be also adjust separately. Cursor Speed: the speed of cursor movement. Max Camera Angle: the maximum move-around distance of camera. You can set it lower if the default camera move-around is too high. Boundary Deceleration: The delay of mouse input when out of the screen. Default number is 0. Usually you don't need to adjust it unless some games has unusual cursor off-screen movement."
